title: Month 2 Review and Financial Reporting
description: Comprehensive review of Month 2 and introduction to financial reporting vocabulary (50 items).

items.question: A statement showing assets, liabilities, and capital at a specific point in time is a:
items.explanation: A balance sheet provides a 'snapshot' of a company's financial position at a single point in time.

items.question: The total income produced by a source is called ________.
items.explanation: Revenue is the total amount of money brought in by a business's operations.

items.question: We ________ a new office in London next year. (Planned)
items.explanation: We use 'going to' for planned future actions.

items.question: She ________ (work) in this bank since 2018.
items.explanation: The present perfect 'has worked' is used for an action starting in the past and continuing to the present.

items.question: The accountant calculated the figures ________.
items.explanation: We use the adverb 'accurately' to describe how the figures were calculated.

items.question: When expenses are higher than revenue, the company has a ________.
items.explanation: A loss occurs when a business spends more than it earns.

items.question: An official inspection of an organization's accounts is an:
items.explanation: An audit is a systematic and independent examination of books and records.

items.question: The difference between cost and selling price is the ________.
items.explanation: Margin (or profit margin) represents the percentage of revenue that exceeds costs.

items.question: I think the interest rates ________ next month. (Prediction)
items.explanation: We use 'will' for predictions about the future.

items.question: We ________ (just/finish) the annual report.
items.explanation: The present perfect with 'just' describes a recently completed action.

items.question: Which statement shows profit and loss over a period of time?
items.explanation: An income statement reports a company's financial performance over a specific accounting period.

items.question: The company performed ________ (good) last quarter.
items.explanation: The irregular adverb form of 'good' is 'well'.

items.question: A loan to buy a house is called a:
items.explanation: A mortgage is a specific loan used for real estate.

items.question: A person who owes money is a ________.
items.explanation: A debtor is someone who has the obligation to pay back a debt.

items.question: I ________ you with those bank transfers right now. (Spontaneous)
items.explanation: We use 'will' for spontaneous decisions or offers made at the moment of speaking.

items.question: Have you ________ (ever/visit) our branch in New York?
items.explanation: Present perfect is used to ask about life experiences.

items.question: The 'P&L' stands for:
items.explanation: P&L is a common abbreviation for the Income Statement.

items.question: He speaks English ________ (fluent) in meetings.
items.explanation: The adverb form of 'fluent' is 'fluently'.

items.question: A comprehensive report of a company's activities for the year is the:
items.explanation: Annual reports are prepared once a year for shareholders and other interested parties.

items.question: The opposite of 'profit' is ________.
items.explanation: A profit is a gain, while a loss is a deficit.

items.question: Which of these is NOT a financial statement?
items.explanation: A credit score is a personal metric, not a corporate financial statement.

items.question: We ________ (not/decide) on the budget yet.
items.explanation: Present perfect with 'yet' describes an action that hasn't happened up to now.

items.question: The market is moving ________.
items.explanation: 'Fast' is an irregular adverb that does not take -ly.

items.question: The maximum amount you can borrow is the credit ________.
items.explanation: The credit limit is the cap on a line of credit.

items.question: Assets minus liabilities equals:
items.explanation: Equity represents the owners' residual interest in the assets after deducting liabilities.

items.question: The interest rate is ________ (high) than last year.
items.explanation: This is a comparative adjective, often used in financial reporting.

items.question: The manager ________ a meeting for tomorrow morning.
items.explanation: Present perfect used for a past action with relevance to the present (the meeting is now on the schedule).

items.question: Please handle the documents ________ (careful).
items.explanation: Adverb describing how to handle the documents.

items.question: What is 'cash flow'?
options: The total value of a company
The movement of money in and out
The interest paid on a loan
items.answer: The movement of money in and out
items.explanation: Cash flow tracks the actual liquidity of a business.

items.question: The ________ is the person who lends the money.
items.explanation: A creditor provides credit to a debtor.

items.question: Next quarter, we ________ to increase our revenue by 10%.
items.explanation: Present continuous can be used for future expectations/intentions.

items.question: I ________ (never/be) to the head office in London.
items.explanation: Present perfect for life experience.

items.question: The results were ________ better than expected.
items.explanation: Adverb modifying the adjective 'better'.

items.question: A numerical representation of creditworthiness is the credit ________.
items.explanation: A credit score helps lenders assess risk.

items.question: In a balance sheet, 'liabilities' are:
items.explanation: Liabilities are debts or obligations.

items.question: He worked ________ (hard) to meet the deadline.
items.explanation: 'Hard' is an irregular adverb.

items.question: We ________ our targets this year.
items.explanation: Present perfect with 'already' for an action completed before now.

items.question: The auditor examined the records ________ (thorough).
items.explanation: Adverb form of 'thorough'.

items.question: What is an 'asset'?
options: Something of value owned by a company
items.answer: Something of value owned by a company
items.explanation: Assets include cash, inventory, property, etc.

items.question: The ________ rate is the cost of borrowing money.
items.explanation: Interest rates are expressed as a percentage.

items.question: They ________ the loan application tomorrow. (Scheduled)
items.explanation: 'Going to' for scheduled/planned future actions.

items.question: How ________ (long) have you worked in finance?
items.explanation: Standard question structure for duration with present perfect.

items.question: Which adverb is irregular?
items.explanation: 'Fast' is both adjective and adverb.

items.question: The ________ flow statement shows how much cash is available.
items.explanation: Cash flow is vital for operational liquidity.

items.question: A 'surplus' means:
items.explanation: A surplus is an excess of production or supply over demand.

items.question: He ________ (write) three reports this week.
items.explanation: Present perfect for a time period that is not yet finished.

items.question: We must act ________ to solve this problem.
items.explanation: Adverb meaning right away.

items.question: A sum of money borrowed for a vehicle is an ________ loan.
items.explanation: Auto loans are for cars, trucks, etc.

items.question: A mortgage is usually a ________ debt.
items.explanation: Mortgages often last for decades.

items.question: The CEO spoke ________ (clear) about the new goals.
items.explanation: Adverb form of 'clear'.
